alert.note: Alert for Eastern Dutchess; Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 24 at 3:28AM EST until February 25 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 PM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 8 inches and ice accumulations of up to one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Ulster and Dutchess Counties of eastern New York. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 7 PM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes Friday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Maximum snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are expected, mainly late tonight into early Friday morning. Snow will change to sleet early Friday morning, with a brief period of freezing rain possible later Friday morning. Mixed precipitation may change back to snow Friday afternoon before ending.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Dutchess; Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess; Western Ulster
